entities.description: "GRU network is a type of neural network used for modeling short-term user representations in the context of online news recommendation."
"Okura et al., 2017 are referenced for their work on using a simple dot product for computing news click probability scores."
"Huang et al., 2013 are referenced for their work on using negative sampling technique for model training."
"Zhai et al., 2016 are referenced for their work on using negative sampling technique for model training."
"LSTUR-ini is a method for combining long-term and short-term user representations by initializing the hidden state of the GRU network with the long-term user representation."
"LSTUR-con is a method for combining long-term and short-term user representations by concatenating them."
"NBA is mentioned as an example of a long-term interest for online users, specifically basketball fans."
"User IDs are used to learn long-term representations of users to capture their consistent preferences."
"News articles are the content that users interact with in the context of online news recommendation services."
"Online users are individuals who have both short-term and long-term interests in reading news, and are the subject of user representation modeling."
"News recommendation services are the online platforms that provide personalized news recommendations to users."
"Model training refers to the process of training the news recommendation model using user and news representations."
"News click prediction is the task of predicting the probability of a user clicking on a news article."
"Negative sampling is a technique used in model training where unclicked news articles are used as negative samples."
"Pseudo $K+1$-way classification task is how the news click prediction problem is reformulated using negative sampling."
"New coming users are users who have not yet been incorporated into the news recommendation model training."
"Long-term representations refer to the learned representations of users that capture their consistent preferences over time."
"Short-term user representations are computed to capture the temporal interests of online users."
"Unified user representation is the combined representation of long-term and short-term user presentations."

relationships.description: "The GRU network is used in the context of a scoring function inspired by Okura et al., 2017."
"The GRU network is used in a model training approach motivated by the work of Huang et al., 2013."
"The GRU network is used in a model training approach motivated by the work of Zhai et al., 2016."
"LSTUR-ini is a method that uses the GRU network to initialize the hidden state with long-term user representations."
"LSTUR-con is a method that concatenates long-term user representations with the output of the GRU network."
"NBA is an example of a long-term interest for a subset of online users, specifically basketball fans."
"User IDs are used to learn the long-term representations of users."
"News articles are the content provided by news recommendation services to users."
"Online users have short-term user representations that capture their temporal interests."
"Model training involves the use of negative sampling technique."
"News click prediction is reformulated as a pseudo $K+1$-way classification task."
"New coming users may not have long-term representations in the model."
"Unified user representation includes long-term representations."
"Unified user representation includes short-term user representations."

entities.description: "NBA is a professional basketball league in North America, indicated as an important sports news topic."
"MSN news is an online news platform that labels news articles with topic and subtopic categories."
"Sports is a general topic category used to label news articles, indicating user interests."
"Football NFL is a subtopic category under the Sports topic, used for news article categorization."
"Mission: Impossible 6 – Fallout is an event, specifically a movie, that influences user interest in related news articles."
"Tom Cruise is an actor related to the movie 'Mission: Impossible 6 – Fallout', and a potential interest for users who read related news."
CNN Network is part of the Title Encoder, used to learn contextual word representations by capturing local context information.
"ReLU stands for Rectified Linear Unit, a type of activation function used in the CNN network."
"Bahdanau et al., 2015 refers to the authors of the attention network model used in the news encoder framework."
"tanh is the hyperbolic tangent function, used in the formulation of the attention weight in the attention network."
"LSTUR approach refers to the Long-Short Term User Representation approach, a framework for user and news representation."
"STUR stands for Short-Term User Representation model, used to capture user's temporal interests."
"LTUR stands for Long-Term User Representation model, used to capture user's consistent preferences."
"GRU stands for Gated Recurrent Units, a type of recurrent neural network used to capture sequential news reading patterns."
"Okura et al., 2017 refers to the authors whose work on news reading patterns is referenced in the context of using GRU networks."
"Cho et al., 2014 refers to the authors of the original GRU network model."

relationships.description: "NBA is a part of the Sports topic, indicating that NBA news falls under the sports category."
"MSN news uses the Sports topic category to label news articles, helping target user interests."
"MSN news uses the Football NFL subtopic to categorize news articles under the Sports topic."
"The event 'Mission: Impossible 6 – Fallout' is related to Tom Cruise, as he is an actor in the movie."
"The CNN network uses ReLU as an activation function in its convolutional filters."
"The CNN network incorporates the attention network model by Bahdanau et al., 2015 to select important words in news titles."
"The attention network model by Bahdanau et al., 2015 uses the tanh function in the formulation of the attention weight."
"The LSTUR approach includes the STUR model to capture short-term user interests."
"The LSTUR approach includes the LTUR model to capture long-term user preferences."
"The STUR model uses GRU networks to capture sequential news reading patterns."
"The GRU network model was originally proposed by Cho et al., 2014."

entities.description: "LSTUR-con is a model that uses the concatenation of both short-term and long-term user representations for news recommendation."
"LSTUR-ini is a model that focuses on either long-term or short-term user representations for news recommendation."
"LTUR is a long-term user representation model used for news recommendation."
"STUR is a short-term user representation model used for news recommendation."
"GRU is used in the STUR model to learn short-term user representations from recent browsing news."
"Average is a method that uses the average of all news representations in recent browsing history."
"Attention is a method that uses the summation of news representations weighted by their attention weights."
LSTM is a sequence-based encoder used in the STUR model for learning short-term user representations and can replace GRU. It is associated with the development by Hochreiter and Schmidhuber.
"CNN+Att is a news encoder that combines a CNN network and an attention network."
"CNN is a variant of the news title encoder used for learning news representations."
"LSTM+Att is a variant of the news title encoder that includes an attention mechanism."
"Hochreiter and Schmidhuber are associated with the development of the LSTM model, referenced in the context of replacing GRU."
"News Encoders are evaluated in the STUR model for their effectiveness in encoding news, with GRU outperforming LSTM."
"News Title Encoders are compared in terms of effectiveness, with CNN+Att showing better performance than other variants."
"Attention Mechanism is used in encoders based on CNN and LSTM to select important words for learning more informative news representations."
"News Topic is a component of the news encoder that, when incorporated, improves the performance of news recommendation."
"News Subtopic is a more fine-grained component of the news encoder that outperforms News Topic in improving news recommendation performance."
"Masking Probability refers to the probability p in Eq. (6) for randomly masking long-term user representation in model training, which is explored for its influence on model performance."

relationships.description: "LSTUR-con and LSTUR-ini are compared for performance in news recommendation, with LSTUR-con showing more stability."
"LSTUR-con is compared with LTUR to show the effectiveness of combining long-term and short-term user representations."
"LSTUR-con incorporates elements of STUR to improve news recommendation performance."
"GRU is selected as the news encoder in STUR due to its better performance over LSTM."
"STUR outperforms the Average method in encoding news for short-term user representations."
"STUR outperforms the Attention method in encoding news for short-term user representations."
"CNN+Att outperforms CNN in learning news title representations due to the effectiveness of the attention mechanism."
"CNN+Att outperforms LSTM+Att, indicating the importance of local contexts in news titles for news representation."
"LSTM is compared with GRU in the STUR model, with GRU showing better performance due to fewer parameters and lower risk of overfitting."
"Hochreiter and Schmidhuber are associated with the development of LSTM, which is evaluated in the STUR model."
"GRU is selected over LSTM in News Encoders due to better performance in encoding news for short-term user representations."
"The effectiveness of News Title Encoders is improved by incorporating the Attention Mechanism, as seen in CNN+Att."
"News Subtopic provides more fine-grained information than News Topic and outperforms it in the news encoder for news recommendation."
"The influence of Masking Probability on model training is explored for LSTUR-ini, affecting its performance."
"The influence of Masking Probability on model training is explored for LSTUR-con, affecting its performance."

"LSTUR-con is another method used in the study to randomly mask long-term user representation in model training."

entities.description: "MSN News is the source of the dataset used for news recommendation experiments."
"LSTUR refers to a news recommendation approach that outperforms baseline methods by capturing both long-term preferences and short-term interests of users."
"LibFM is a state-of-the-art matrix factorization method used as a baseline in the news recommendation experiments."
"DeepFM is a method that combines factorization machines and deep neural networks, used as a baseline in the experiments."
"Wide & Deep is a deep learning-based recommendation method that combines wide and deep channels, used as a baseline in the experiments."
"DSSM, or deep structured semantic model, is used as a baseline method in the news recommendation experiments."
"CNN refers to a method using convolutional neural networks with max pooling for learning news representations, used as a baseline."
"DKN is a deep news recommendation model containing CNN and candidate-aware attention, used as a baseline in the experiments."
"GRU refers to a method that learns news representations by a denoising autoencoder and user representations by a GRU network, used as a baseline."
"LSTURini is a proposed method for learning short-term user representations, achieving comparable performance to LSTUR-con."
"LSTUR-con is a proposed method for learning long-term user representations, achieving comparable performance to LSTURini and outperforming baseline methods."
"GloVe, created by Pennington et al., is used for initializing word embeddings in the experiments."
"Adam, introduced by Kingma and Ba, is used for model optimization in the experiments."
"AUC, or area under the ROC curve, is an impression-based ranking metric used to evaluate the performance of the model."
"MRR, or mean reciprocal rank, is an impression-based ranking metric used to evaluate the performance of the model."
"nDCG, or normalized discounted cumulative gain, is an impression-based ranking metric used to evaluate the performance of the model."
"Table 1 summarizes the statistics of the dataset used in the experiments for news recommendation."
"Table 2 summarizes the results of comparing different methods in news recommendation."
"December 23rd, 2018 marks the start date of the four-week log collection period from MSN News."
"January 19th, 2019 marks the end date of the four-week log collection period from MSN News."
"Bernoulli distribution is mentioned in the context of the model training trick involving a random variable subject to B(1,1-p)."
"Dropout, introduced by Srivastava et al., is applied to each layer in the approach to mitigate overfitting."
"The long-term user representation masking probability $p$ is a default value used in model training, set to 0.5."
"Batch size refers to the number of samples processed before the model is updated, set to 400 in the experiments."
"The number of negative samples for each positive sample is a hyperparameter set to 4 in the experiments."

relationships.description: "MSN News provided the dataset used to evaluate the performance of the LSTUR approach in news recommendation."

"LSTUR outperforms GRU in capturing user preferences for news recommendation."
"LSTURini and LSTUR-con achieve comparable performance in learning user representations for news recommendation."

"Adam is used to optimize the LSTUR model in the experiments."

entities.entity_name: "NEURAL NEWS RECOMMENDATION WITH LONG- AND SHORT-TERM USER REPRESENTATIONS"
entities.description: "Neural News Recommendation with Long- and Short-term User Representations is the title of the paper discussing a new approach to personalized news recommendation."
"Google News is an online news platform that distributes news to users."
"Golden State Warriors is an NBA team, used as an example of a long-term interest for a user."
"Bohemian Rhapsody is a movie, which triggered related news browsing as a short-term interest example."
"Rami Malek's Oscar win is an event that caused a user to read related news, illustrating short-term interest."
"Personalized news recommendation is the process of helping users find news they are interested in to improve their reading experience."
"Long-term interest refers to user preferences that last for a long time and are consistent."
"Short-term interest refers to user interests that evolve with time and may be triggered by specific contexts or temporal demands."
"News encoder is a component used to learn representations of news articles from their titles and topic categories."
"User encoder is a component consisting of long-term and short-term user representation modules."
"Attention mechanism is used in the news encoder to select important words for learning informative news representations."
"GRU network is used in the user encoder to learn short-term representations of users from their recently browsed news."
"LTUR module refers to the long-term user representation module within the user encoder."
"STUR module refers to the short-term user representation module within the user encoder."

"LTUR refers to the long-term user representation module, which is part of the user encoder system for learning user representations from their IDs."
"STUR stands for short-term user representation module, which uses a GRU network to learn short-term user representations from recent browsing data."

"LSTUR is the neural news recommendation approach that includes both long- and short-term user representations."

"Title Encoder is a sub-module of the News Encoder, used to learn news representations from news titles."

"News recommendation methods are critical for learning accurate news and user representations in the field of natural language processing."
